text.p: These are the leading stories in the Tunisian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Ben Ali chaired a cabinet meeting devoted to the government's policy in the health sector during the next five years. President recommends speeding up reforms in this sector, to rationalise health expenditure, and to boost training.
- Details of the new law on employer's contributions to the social security fund.
- For the month of Ramadan and starting Thursday, retail stores authorised to stay open until midnight.
- Spain supports Tunisia as a venue for the next Europe-Mediterranean countries conference called "Barcelone II" to be held in 1997.

- Visiting Greenpeace Executive Director Thilo Bode on Wednesday met Tunisian officials and praised Tunisia's environment policy. Says Tunisia was the only Arab and African country to authorise a Greenpeace bureau on its territory.
- Prime Minister Hamed Karoui is expected to meet Spanish Prime Minister Jose Maria Aznar next Monday in Madrid.
